meanings.definition: Having only one acidic hydrogen atom.
meanings.sent1: The monacidic solution turned the litmus paper red.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the monacidic compound in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The monacidic lemon juice made the robot malfunction and dance uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her monacidic wit cut through the tension in the room like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The monacidic taste of the vinegar was so strong it made her eyes water.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a substance that contains only one acid group.
meanings.sent1: The monacidic solution reacted quickly with the metal.
meanings.sent2: The monacidic compound was used in the experiment for its unique properties.
meanings.sent3: The monacidic soil in the garden seemed to make the plants grow taller than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her monacidic comment hit him like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The monacidic smell of the chemical lingered in the air long after the experiment was over.
